item.title: Ticket #1468 (load_plugin_textdomain() should accept variable paths) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith

item.title: Ticket #1491 (Adding CURL support to /wp-admin/link-import.php) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Keywords, Milestone changed

I'm starting to think that it would be good to have all the remote file fetching be done by our own class/function that can figure out if fopen(), CURL, or Snoopy is the best choice. It seems that each one is being done its own way. Why not just a generic

$file = wp_get_remote_file($uri);

??

item.title: Ticket #1485 (Don't use trailingslashed IRIs if the user doesn't prefer them) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: Ah! You're right, I did misread it thusly. Let's wait for someone else (yoohoo, Skippy!) to weigh in on this, and then I'll clean up that patch a bit and see how the devs like it.

item.title: Ticket #1495 (Pimping Firefox add_action should be in default-filters.php) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Keywords, Version changed

Seems logical to me. The only thing is that it would be added on every page load, not just admin page loads, but adding a filter is a relatively "free" operation.

item.title: Ticket #1452 (Trackback not working with XML-RPC) updated
item.dc:creator: pombsd
item.description: Just wanted to note that this still does not work in 1.5.1.3, although your bugfix seems to be included. Seems to me as if trackback URLs coming in as arrays still aren't handled correctly.

item.title: Ticket #1495 (Pimping Firefox add_action should be in default-filters.php) created
item.dc:creator: ringmaster
item.description: The add_action() call that causes WordPress to pimp Firefox at the bottom of the admin pages should be in the default-filters.php rather than its current location in admin-functions.php, so that all hooks added by the core are centralized.

item.title: Ticket #1494 (Spurious notices about $HTTP_RAW_POST_DATA) created
item.dc:creator: mgeisler
item.description:
I'm seeing spurious notices from PHP about $HTTP_RAW_POST_DATA not being defined:

PHP Notice: Undefined variable: HTTP_RAW_POST_DATA in /home/mgeisler/mgeisler.net/html/xmlrpc.php on line 4

I guess one could wrap the line in a if(isset($HTTP_RAW_POST_DATA)) and at the same time move the call to logIO("I", $HTTP_RAW_POST_DATA) up in the same wrapping.

Or maybe it would be better to post-pone this processing to class-IXR.php since xmlrpc.php doesn't really use $HTTP_RAW_POST_DATA.
